meta.name: title
meta.content: Guidance for schools, workplaces, & communities | Colorado COVID-19 Updates

link.title: Guidance for schools, workplaces, & communities | Colorado COVID-19 Updates

a.title: Home
Stop the spread of racism
Guidelines for leaders in this time of uncertainty.
COVID-19 has made life harder for some of us, and life was already hard in some cases.
What's the difference between isolation & quarantine?
Colorado crisis standards of care
Guidance for people living with HIV
Public health orders & executive orders in response to COVID-19
Latest blogs on COVID-19
COVID-19 data dashboards
Data on facility outbreaks in Colorado.
Higher risk for severe illness including: Older adults, people with chronic conditions, immunocompromised.

li.a: People at higher risk for severe illness

a.title: In an effort to respond to COVID-19, we have outlined information related to COVID-19 and people living with HIV.

li.a: Resources for older adults and their families

a.title: What's the difference between isolation & quarantine?
How to isolate if you are sick or tested positive for COVID-19
How to quarantine if you were exposed to someone who may be sick with COVID-19
COVID-19 resources for students
Guidance for long-term and residential care facilities
How providers can get started with telehealth.
Crisis Standards of Care are guidelines created to provide guidance to medical professionals when resources are stretched to the breaking point.
Resources are available for other languages.
Videos with information about COVID-19 and how to stay safe.
Resources for businesses and individuals affected by COVID-19
The latest blogs on COVID-19.
he data on this page has been reported to the state of Colorado by hospitals across the state.
Data on outbreaks in all facilities.

div.p: Colorado is under a Stay-at-Home Order. All but essential businesses are closed. Learn more about the stay-at-home order.
Nursing, assisted living and intermediate care facilities are closed to non-essential persons. Call your facility to learn about virtual technologies that allow family to visit.

h5.br: Public health guidance and recommendations to protect our communities

hr.p: We understand these recommendations affect people’s lives. Colorado makes these recommendations in consultation with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and our partner agencies based on the best and most recent information we have to protect the public.

Manufactured food facility workplace precautions | Español | Tiếng Việt | 中文 | Soomaali

hr.h6: Guidance for critical workers who may have been exposed to Covid-19

li.a: Critical infrastructure workers who may have been exposed to COVID-19

hr.p: Most social gatherings are currently are prohibited.

ul.li: Guidance for Places of Worship | Español | Tiếng Việt | 中文 | Soomaali | العربية | नेपाली

hr.p: Schools currently are closed. Please contact your school or district for information about reopening.

ul.li: Face covering guidance for child care operations | Español | Tiếng Việt | 中文 | Soomaali | العربية | नेपाली
Approval of child care operations during COVID. (Updated 4/14/20) | Español | Tiếng Việt | 中文 | Soomaali | العربية | नेपाली

Child care isolation and quarantine for staff and children (see top of page for printable pdf version)

li.a: Planning for Institutions of Higher Education

Worker and customer protection guidelines for non-healthcare industries.
COVID-19: Information for early childhood programs (Department of Human Services)

hr.h6: Nursing, assisted living and intermediate care facilities

ul.li: Public Health Order 20-20 Restricting Visitors at All Colorado Skilled Nursing Facilities, Assisted Living Residences, and Intermediate Care Facilities | Español

li.a: Community partner mitigation guidance for behavioral health

ul.li: Non-essential travel currently is prohibited.

li.a: COVID-19 Resources for Water and Wastewater Utilities
Funeral and Burial Services for American Indians and Alaska Natives

div.p: The Colorado Healthcare Ethics Resource Group has put together guides and tip sheets to help people consider specific medical treatments, values and decision-making during the COVID-19 pandemic. We encourage each of you to have this conversation with your family today.

Conversations about things we do not have power over help to give us a sense of control. We cannot predict every choice we may have to make, but we can give those we love the guidance to confidently make decisions for us. This is the time to help the people closest to us—our friends, our spouses, our parents or grandparents—get the care that is right for them if they become seriously ill with COVID-19.
Use these tools to help guide your planning and conversations.
div.h6:
Tips for people who use personal care assistants or caregivers | Español | Tiếng Việt |
中文 | Soomaali | العربية | नेपाली

div.class: paragraph__card paragraph paragraph--type--card-basic card_no-border paragraph--view-mode--default color__slate

p.br:
We provide free, confidential, professional and immediate support for any mental health, substance use or emotional concern, 24/7/365.
Call 1-844-493-TALK (8255) or text TALK to 38255 to speak to a trained professional.
2-1-1 is a confidential and multilingual service connecting people to vital resources across the state.

span.span: Call 2-11 or (866) 760-6489 Text your ZIP CODE to 898-211

p.br: Colorado’s call line for general questions about the novel coronavirus (COVID-19), providing answers in many languages including English, Spanish (Español), Mandarin (普通话) and more.

div.class: paragraph__card paragraph paragraph--type--card-basic card_no-border paragraph--view-mode--default color__slate

p.span: – Volunteer, donate, contribute, apply for funding.

hr.p: OnwardCO.org – One-stop resource for Coloradans impacted by job loss to connect with life essentials, training, and jobs.
If you have symptoms and think you have been exposed, call a health care provider.

div.class: paragraph__card paragraph paragraph--type--card-basic card_no-border paragraph--view-mode--default color__slate
